meanings.definition: A person who professes his or her patriotism loudly and excessively, favoring an aggressive, warlike foreign policy.
meanings.sent1: The jingoists in the crowd waved flags and chanted slogans at the rally.
meanings.sent2: The group of jingoists demanded a stronger military presence in the region.
meanings.sent3: The jingoists at the parade were so loud that they scared away the pigeons.
meanings.sent4: His speeches were filled with jingoists calling for action against other nations.
meanings.sent5: The image of the jingoists painted a picture of aggressive nationalism.

meanings.definition: A person who shows excessive favoritism towards their own country, often to the detriment of others.
meanings.sent1: The jingoists only supported policies that benefited their own nation.
meanings.sent2: She was known as a jingoist for always putting her country's interests above all else.
meanings.sent3: The jingoists at the game cheered so loudly that they drowned out the opposing team's fans.
meanings.sent4: The politician's jingoists led to strained relations with neighboring countries.
meanings.sent5: The jingoists' actions left a bitter taste in the mouths of those seeking peace.
